messages.message:
@dlluncor @lydia @shaunak @Heymian thrift libraries for python and nodejs have been upgraded to 0.13.0. We are going to upgrade thrift for all services for all languages (python, nodejs, c++, java, c#).
As a result, we will need to perform a UAT to ensure everything is working as expected after these patches.
so sad you missed go

Has the update already happened, did the go lib not need to be updated?

i would love any excuse to be able to update our ancient Go thrift library. It’s so old that that apache didn’t want to host it any more.
I don’t know if Go was included. Only certain language implementations had the vulnerability.
That being said, I think it is ok to update regardless? :’D

| so sad you missed go
oops! Go needs to be updated too. No work has been done yet.
does anyone have free cycles to upgrade all of them? I won't be able to get to the upgrade until late night tonight.
i can do it tonight
thanks a lot!
I need to finish a few customer deliverable. I am planning to ship to SC with thrift 0.10.0 as they really want to move forward with their deploy. For other customers, we'll push thrift 0.13.0.
When you make changes, please remember that these patches will go into `master`, `release-2019-10-21`, `release-2019-10-21.jpmc` and `py3-release-2019-10-21` branches.

@Ashish Is the expectation that we’re all updating our local thrift installations as well ? Everyone currently has 0.10.0 installed locally. Do we have to regenerate all the python thrift files that are checked in?
And should we update our docs to tell everyone to install 0.13.0 now?
It will be so nice not to have to support old versions. :)

do the python thrift files change when we upgrade? — if it all works — then we should update our giant requirements.in (http://requirements.in) file and then yes we can have people update their local development

i think i’m a bit confused by the initial msg. “have been upgraded” = I’m not sure what we’ve done so far? Does it already work with thrift 0.13.0? Or what has been tested. afaik, I think the files generated at not the same because when new hires accidnetally install 0.11.0, the thrift files are different and they get errors.
interesting — i haven’t touched things at all — so not sure if thrift 0.13.0 works — or what type of integration work is required. @Ashish — what is the state of what has happened so far on your end?
The upstream libraries we consume have been upgraded. As far as I know, nothing Instabase side has been updated yet.
For example, the python library for 0.13.0 was released in the last 24 hours
yeah and none of the standard pkg managers support it, had to install it from source. uh oh, did i just kill my thrift installation for no reason
I can take care of debs and osx packages if that helps
(Assuming you mean the thrift lib itself)
haha no clue what to do yet. :stuck_out_tongue:
Catching up on this thread

> thrift libraries for python and nodejs have been upgraded to 0.13.0.
+ 1 to Will. Upstream packages have been upgraded to 0.13.0. Until Sunday evening, these packages were still set to 0.11.0 (for python) and 0.12.0 (for nodejs) on pypi and npm repositories.

1. We will need to upgrade thrift on our laptops and on build machines.
2. Need to upgrade all references in source code to point to 0.13.0
3. Will need to regenerate thrift source code with 0.13.0 and perform a UAT (hopefully this will be a mini UAT)
@Heymian I can help with these changes. Would you like me to? Need to fast track these changes as many customers are waiting for deployments.
I actually think @will was on track for doing a bunch of this testing. I need to keep my local dev functional to work on the account stuff
Or I can start setting up another laptop (can grab the spare when I’m in next). But I don’t really want to nuke my ability to do development.
Sounds good. I had setup a clone of build machine with thrift 0.13.0 to test and to avoid nuking my local setup

```ashish@clone-build-machine-v17-09-26:~$ thrift --version
Thrift version 0.13.0```
```https://console.cloud.google.com/compute/instancesDetail/zones/us-central1-a/instances/clone-build-machine-v17-09-26?project=instabase-build&folder&organizationId```
haha but I think the whole company will riot if we destroy their local dev setup/if we neglect Mac testing and setup instructions
Yes, we don't want a riot. At the same time, we need to move forward to grow business with jpmc, gs india and baml.
^ did not mean/intend to say that we shouldn’t brow biz with all these countries/customers!
yes, of course, I am aware, Heymian! :slightly_smiling_face:
these customers make us dance to their tunes sometimes :(
